Race.SummaryText:
PARISHWIDE PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  TO AUTHORIZE RELOCATION OF RIVERBOAT GAMING ACTIVITIES TO SUGARCANE BAY RESORT AND CASINO, TO BE SITUATED IN CALCASIEU PARISH ALONG THE CALCASIEU RIVER, ADJACENT TO THE EXISTING L'AUBERGE DU LAC RESORT.
Race.FullText: Shall Sugarcane Bay Resort and Casino, to be owned and operated by a subsidiary of Pinnacle Entertainment, Inc., be allowed to conduct riverboat gaming within the City of Lake Charles, at a location adjacent to Pinnacle's existing L'Auberge du Lac Resort along the Calcasieu River, pursuant to an existing license to be reissued by the Louisiana Gaming Control Board authorizing relocation of the berth or docking facility of that license from another site within the City of Lake Charles to Sugarcane Bay Resort and Casino, all in accordance with the Louisiana Gaming Control Law?

Race.SpecificTitle: City of Lake Charles -- $90,000,000 Bond - City Council - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
CITY OF LAKE CHARLES PROPOSITION

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR CITY OF LAKE CHARLES, LOUISIANA, TO ACQUIRE AND/OR CONSTRUCT VARIOUS PUBLIC IMPROVEMENTS AND GOVERNMENTAL INFRASTRUCTURE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT FACILITIES WITHIN SAID CITY, TO BE FUNDED THROUGH ISSUANCE OF NOT EXCEEDING $90,000,000 IN BONDS, NOTES OR LOANS TO BE SECURED BY AND PAYABLE FROM LEVY AND COLLECTION OF NEW 1/4 OF 1% SALES TAX AND NEW 2.5 MILL AD VALOREM TAX, GAMING AND OTHER UTILITY REVENUES COOPERATIVELY BETWEEN THE CITY AND CALCASIEU PARISH, LOUISIANA, AND EXISTING UTILITY REVENUES AND SALES TAXES.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Lake Charles, Louisiana ("City") acquire, construct, or improve streets and roads, parks and recreational facilities, water and waste water systems, downtown and/or lakefront development infrastructure and economic development facilities within the City and pursuant to cooperative endeavor agreements with Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana ("Parish"), title to which shall be in the public ("Projects"); which Projects shall be funded by the City through (A) levy, assessment and collection of (i) sixty (60%) percent of gaming revenues received by the City, (ii) a twenty (20) year sales and use tax of 1/4 of 1% within the City, (iii) a twenty (20) year ad valorem tax not to exceed 2.5 mills, (iv) utility fees and revenues received by the City, and (v) existing sales tax and utility revenues received by the City not otherwise dedicated to payment of outstanding debt (collectively "Revenues"), and (B) issuance of bonds, notes or loans in an amount not exceeding $90,000,000 and any limitation prescribed by the Constitution and statutes of the State of Louisiana, in various series, not to exceed 20 years, with interest at a rate not exceeding seven and one-half (7.5%) percent per annum, which bonds, notes or loans shall be retired with, paid from and secured by a pledge and dedication of Revenues?

Race.SpecificTitle: Waterworks Dist. 14/Wd. 5 -- Prop. #1 -  $1,288,000 Bond - BOC - 20 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 1
(BOND)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR WATERWORKS DISTRICT NO. FOURTEEN OF WARD FIVE OF CALCASIEU PARISH, LOUISIANA, TO ISSUE NOT EXCEEDING $1,288,000 OF UP TO 20-YEAR PUBLIC IMPROVEMENT BONDS FOR ACQUIRING, IMPROVING, EXTENDING AND MAINTAINING A WATERWORKS SYSTEM INCLUDING EQUIPMENT AND INSTALLATIONS WITHIN AND FOR THE DISTRICT, SAID BONDS TO BE PAYABLE FROM AD VALOREM TAXES.
Race.FullText: Shall Waterworks District No. Fourteen of Ward Five of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, incur debt and issue bonds in an amount not exceeding $1,288,000 for a period not to exceed twenty (20) years from the date thereof, with interest at a rate not exceeding eight (8%) percent per annum, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, extending and maintaining a waterworks system including all necessary facilities, equipment and installations as may be proper to be used in supplying water to the citizens and residents of the District, title to which shall be in the public, which said bonds shall be retired with, paid from and secured by ad valorem taxes on all taxable property within the limits of Waterworks District No. Fourteen of Ward Five of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana, sufficient in rate and amount to pay said bonds in principal and interest?

Race.SpecificTitle: Waterworks Dist. 14/Wd. 5 -- Prop. #2 - 15 Mill - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
PROPOSITION NO. 2
(MAINTENANCE MILLAGE)

SUMMARY:  AUTHORITY FOR WATERWORKS DISTRICT NO. FOURTEEN OF WARD FIVE OF CALCASIEU PARISH, LOUISIANA, TO LEVY AND COLLECT A 10-YEAR MAINTENANCE TAX NOT EXCEEDING FIFTEEN (15) MILLS FOR THE PURPOSE OF MAINTAINING AND OPERATING THE DISTRICT'S WATERWORKS SYSTEM, EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES.
Race.FullText: Shall Waterworks District No. Fourteen of Ward Five of Calcasieu Parish, Louisiana ("District"), levy and collect a tax not exceeding 15 mills for a period not to exceed ten (10) years beginning in 2007, in excess of and in addition to other taxes levied by the District, for the purpose of maintaining and operating the District's waterworks system, equipment and facilities, including both movable and immovable property, owned or used by the District, title to which shall be in the public?
